We are looking for a Postdoc Researcher to help us build a framework to protect programs from hardware attacks!
 The position is offering the chance to conduct research, supervise PhD students and research engineers, and collaborate with experts in security.
 Having experience in formal verification, microarchitectural security, program analysis, or compiler design is a plus.
 Join us at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm!
 Apply here: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/796677?l=en

If you are into microarchitectural attacks, check out our recent arXiv paper. To summarize, we show that the devil is in the 'micro' details!
 We analyzed the microcode of Intel processors and showed the root cause of many Spectre attacks. We found out that some of the known variants are indeed misclassified.

 More details and experiments on other x86 processors are hopefully coming soon in the paper's conference version: https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.12890
